comments.body:
Its not legal to do reflect.DeepEqual on protos generated by newer protoc versions. https://groups.google.com/g/golang-nuts/c/-p-KiwYE598 describes this a bit.

The issue is data gets encoded into private fields that are implementation details and should not be directly compared. The recommended way is actually using protocmp but I didn't want to introduce a new dependency
ok. why adding '\n' in the line below?
oh that was to make it easier to view the failure, I can revert if necessary
that is fine as is. just wondering that '\n' is only added in this one line below, but not in others.
This took ~2 seconds before the fix, and 2ms after.
Please ensure that at least some unit test runs multiple groups and/or versions, otherwise the concurrency isn't really tested.

TestServerPreferredNamespacedResources does (and was flaking on my original PR which was why I noticed)

Also added an additional version to TestGetServerResources and added order-sensitive checks to the test

this flakes, especially it broke the publishing bot:
